publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1043 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Steeplejacks—That the Parliament pays tribute to the skills of the nation’s steeplejacks who maintain our monuments, churches and major buildings and undertake work which makes them "heroes on high" and, in particular, pays tribute to Mr Mick Hatton, who lost his life while working at Edinburgh Castle and sends its tribute and respects to Mr Hatton’s family at their time of sorrow.

S1M-1043 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Steeplejacks—That the Parliament pays tribute to the skills of the nation’s steeplejacks who maintain our monuments, churches and major buildings and undertake work which makes them "heroes on high" and, in particular, pays tribute to Mr Mick Hatton, who lost his life while working at Edinburgh Castle and sends its tribute and respects to Mr Hatton’s family at their time of sorrow.
S1M-1043 Steeplejacks (lodged on 21 June 2000) Andrew Wilson*

S1M-1043 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Steeplejacks—That the Parliament pays tribute to the skills of the nation’s steeplejacks who maintain our monuments, churches and major buildings and undertake work which makes them "heroes on high" and, in particular, pays tribute to Mr Mick Hatton, who lost his life while working at Edinburgh Castle and sends its tribute and respects to Mr Hatton’s family at their time of sorrow. Supported by: Andrew Wilson

S1M-1043 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Steeplejacks-That the Parliament pays tribute to the skills of the nation's steeplejacks who maintain our monuments, churches and major buildings and undertake work which makes them "heroes on high" and, in particular, pays tribute to Mr Mick Hatton, who lost his life while working at Edinburgh Castle and sends its tribute and respects to Mr Hatton's family at their time of sorrow. Supported by: Andrew Wilson
S1M-1043 Steeplejacks (lodged on 21 June 2000) Fergus Ewing*

S1M-1043 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Steeplejacks-That the Parliament pays tribute to the skills of the nation's steeplejacks who maintain our monuments, churches and major buildings and undertake work which makes them "heroes on high" and, in particular, pays tribute to Mr Mick Hatton, who lost his life while working at Edinburgh Castle and sends its tribute and respects to Mr Hatton's family at their time of sorrow. Supported by: Andrew Wilson, Fergus Ewing

S1M-1043 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Steeplejacks-That the Parliament pays tribute to the skills of the nation's steeplejacks who maintain our monuments, churches and major buildings and undertake work which makes them "heroes on high" and, in particular, pays tribute to Mr Mick Hatton, who lost his life while working at Edinburgh Castle and sends its tribute and respects to Mr Hatton's family at their time of sorrow. Supported by: Andrew Wilson, Fergus Ewing
S1M-1043 Steeplejacks (lodged on 21 June 2000) Tricia Marwick*
S1M-1043 Steeplejacks (lodged on 21 June 2000) Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-1043 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Steeplejacks-That the Parliament pays tribute to the skills of the nation's steeplejacks who maintain our monuments, churches and major buildings and undertake work which makes them "heroes on high" and, in particular, pays tribute to Mr Mick Hatton, who lost his life while working at Edinburgh Castle and sends its tribute and respects to Mr Hatton's family at their time of sorrow. Supported by: Andrew Wilson, Fergus Ewing, Tricia Marwick, Tommy Sheridan

Supported by: Andrew Wilson, Fergus Ewing, Tricia Marwick, Tommy Sheridan

Supported by: Andrew Wilson, Fergus Ewing, Tricia Marwick, Tommy Sheridan
